@graph.d3f:definition: The process of temporarily disabling user accounts on a system or domain.
@graph.rdfs:label: Account Locking

@graph.d3f:definition: Removing tokens or credentials from an authentication cache to prevent further user associated account accesses.
@graph.rdfs:label: Authentication Cache Invalidation

@graph.d3f:definition: Credential Eviction techniques disable or remove compromised credentials from a computer network.
@graph.rdfs:label: Credential Eviction

@graph.d3f:definition: Deleting a set of credentials permanently to prevent them from being used to authenticate.
@graph.rdfs:label: Credential Revocation

@graph.d3f:definition: Flushing DNS to clear any IP addresses or other DNS records from the cache.
@graph.rdfs:label: DNS Cache Eviction

@graph.d3f:definition: Disk Erasure is the process of securely deleting all data on a disk to ensure that it cannot be recovered by any means.
@graph.rdfs:label: Disk Erasure

@graph.d3f:definition: Disk Formatting is the process of preparing a data storage device, such as a hard drive, solid-state drive, or USB flash drive, for initial use.
@graph.rdfs:label: Disk Formatting

@graph.d3f:definition: Disk Partitioning is the process of dividing a disk into multiple distinct sections, known as partitions.
@graph.rdfs:label: Disk Partitioning

@graph.d3f:definition: The process of performing a takedown of the attacker's domain registration infrastructure.
@graph.rdfs:label: Domain Registration Takedown

@graph.d3f:definition: The email removal technique deletes email files from system storage.
@graph.rdfs:label: Email Removal

@graph.d3f:definition: File eviction techniques delete files from system storage.
@graph.rdfs:label: File Eviction

@graph.d3f:definition: Initiating a host's reboot sequence to terminate all running processes.
@graph.rdfs:label: Host Reboot

@graph.d3f:definition: Initiating a host's shutdown sequence to terminate all running processes.
@graph.rdfs:label: Host Shutdown

@graph.d3f:definition: Terminate or remove an object from a host machine. This is the broadest class for object eviction.
@graph.rdfs:label: Object Eviction

@graph.d3f:definition: Process eviction techniques terminate or remove running process.
@graph.rdfs:label: Process Eviction

@graph.d3f:definition: Suspending a running process on a computer system.
@graph.rdfs:label: Process Suspension

@graph.d3f:definition: Terminating a running application process on a computer system.
@graph.rdfs:label: Process Termination

@graph.d3f:definition: Delete a registry key.
@graph.rdfs:label: Registry Key Deletion

@graph.d3f:definition: Forcefully end all active sessions associated with compromised accounts or devices.
@graph.rdfs:label: Session Termination

@graph.d3f:definition: The eviction tactic is used to remove an adversary from a computer network.
@graph.rdfs:label: Evict
